member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.IOUtil.ResizeFile(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the length of a file, truncating or padding as needed.
member.remarks: Note that this only operates on normal files, and cannot be successfully used on compressed files or special streams.
member.exception: The stream does not support both writing and seeking.
Attempted to set the value parameter to less than 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.IOUtil.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if a file exists.
member.returns: true if a file with a name of fileName exists, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.IOUtil.ExpandWildcards(System.String)
member.summary: Expand an extended wildcard pattern into a set of file paths.
member.returns: the set of file paths matching the pattern
member.remarks: The wildcard pattern accepts the standard "*" and "?" placeholders. "..." also refers to a recursive search over subdirectories. "+" can also be used to make a union of several filenames or patterns. In addition to filenames, HTTP URLs, nul, null, $, -, and Cosmos stream names are all recognized as elements. Names of files that do not exist will be excluded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.IOUtil.ReadLines(System.String)
member.summary: Read the lines of the file or stream specified by fileName.
member.param: the file to read (or URL, or Cosmos stream...)
member.returns: the lines of fileName, or null if it cannot be read
member.exception: The utilities needed to open a stream are not available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.ZStreamReader
member.summary: Class to create StreamReaders given file paths.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.ZStreamReader.AllowLibraryFallback
member.summary: Get or set whether to allow fallback to the compression library if executables are not found in the path. false by default. Using the fallback may result in slower performance and larger files. This setting is shared with ZStreamIn, ZStreamOut, ZStreamReader, and ZStreamWriter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.ZStreamReader.DefaultToLocalEncoding
member.summary: Get or set whether to default to the local encoding, rather than a lenient UTF8.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.ZStreamReader.FallbackExtension
member.summary: Get or set extension to look to append when the given filename does not exist. If set to empty string (the default), try all known extensions; if set to null, disable. This is mapped to ZStreamIn.FallbackExtension.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.ZStreamReader.OpenUnbuffered(System.String)
member.summary: Open the specified file (with unbuffered I/O, if possible).
member.param: name of the file to open
member.returns: A StreamReader for the (possibly uncompressed) text

remarks.para: Unbuffered I/O can give better performance, especially on fast RAID arrays. It does not use the system file cache. This is the only way to get speeds over 60 MB/sec or more on reading (350 MB/sec or more is possible on a good array).
While compressed files and special stream names will be understood, unbuffered I/O will not be enabled on anything but simple files.

member.exception: The utilities needed to open a stream are not available.

member.summary: Class to create output Streams given file paths.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.ZStreamOut.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Get or set the compression level (0 - 9) used for compressed streams.

remarks.p: The default is 1, which is the worst (but fastest) compression. Setting a higher level can significantly improve the compression ratio, especially for tighter compression methods (such as 7z), but the time needed will increase.
If file size is a problem, raising this value can help.
A setting of 0 represents storing without compression for methods that support this.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.ZStreamOut.DefaultLowFragmentation

member.remarks: The has strong advantages, increasing write speed and decreasing fragmentation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.Var
member.summary: Convenience type to represent a value that should be easily converted.

remarks.para: Var instance are immutable.
In the current form, Var is not very efficient - the value is always stored internally as a string, and it is a reference type.

A Var will implicitly convert to and from primitive numerical types, as well as , , and . It can also be compared for equality or order with those types. Comparisons are performed by converting the Var to the type of the other value (for example, comparing to 123 will cause a numerical comparison, while "123" will cause a string comparison).
Numbers will be parsed properly if they contain commas, are in exponential notation, or have surrounding whitespace. Hex numbers can be specified by starting with "0x" or "-0x".
String methods can be used directly, without casting the value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.LowFragmentationStream.TrimOverextension(System.String)
member.summary: Remove allocated space that was not written to.
member.returns: true if the file is resized; false otherwise
member.remarks: This is not normally needed. The LowFragmentationStream trims itself upon finalization. However, if the runtime is terminated abruptly, it is possible for a file to be left with unused space. In that case, this method will remove the unused space.
member.exception: Append is specified, and the file cannot be found.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream
member.summary: Stream using unbuffered I/O for efficient reading from fast disk arrays.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.ParallelRead
member.summary: Get or Set whether to read in the background in a separate thread.

remarks.p: This does not affect existing instances.
Normally, it is faster to perform a multithreaded read, even on a single-processor machine. However, the thread creation cost does make it somewhat more expensive to create an instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.BufferSize
member.summary: Get or Set the memory used for reading, in bytes.

remarks.p: If the memory cannot be allocated, a backoff strategy will be used.

member.returns: drive sector size in bytes

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.Read(System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Reads a block of bytes from the stream and writes the data into a buffer. The buffer is automatically allocated, but it may be shared across calls to this method.
member.param: the array in which the values are replaced by the bytes read
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This will be 0 if the end of the stream has been reached, and is guaranteed to be less than buffer.Length only if fewer than buffer.Length bytes remain (and it will then equal the remainder of the bytes).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.Read(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads a block of bytes from the stream and writes the data in a given buffer.
member.param: the array in which the values are replaced by the bytes read
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This will be 0 if the end of the stream has been reached, and is guaranteed to be less than buffer.Length only if fewer than buffer.Length bytes remain (and it will then equal the remainder of the bytes).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a block of bytes from the stream and writes the data in a given buffer.
member.param: the array in which the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) are replaced by the bytes read
The byte offset in array at which to begin reading.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This will be 0 if the end of the stream has been reached, and is guaranteed to be less than count only if fewer than count bytes remain (and it will then equal the remainder of the bytes).
member.exception: The counts are out of range.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.Read(System.Byte*@)
member.summary: Read a block of bytes from the stream and advance the position.
member.param: returns a pointer to a (pinned) buffer of bytes read from the stream
member.returns: the number of bytes read - this will be positive unless the end of stream has been reached, in which case it will be 0
member.remarks: The buffer returned here may be shared across calls to this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Retrieve the next byte in the stream and advance the position.
member.returns: the next byte, or -1 if at end of stream
member.remarks: This is not as efficient as block reading, because of overhead issues.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.Peek
member.summary: Retrieve the next byte in the stream, without advancing the position.
member.returns: the next byte, or -1 if at end of stream
member.remarks: This is not as efficient as block reading, because of overhead issues.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.Eof
member.summary: Check if the end of file has been reached.
member.returns: true if no more bytes remain; false otherwise

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.IsAsync
member.summary: Get whether the stream was opened asynchronously. Always false, but this does not matter for managed code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.Flush
member.summary: Write all pending data. This method does nothing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.IO.UnbufferedStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the length of the file - not supported.
member.param: the length that the file will not be set to

member.summary: Write a section of buffer to the stream - not supported.
member.param: the buffer that will not be written
the offset in buffer at which to not start writing
the number of bytes to not write
